element.name: genitofemoral nerve, genital
element.distribution: cremaster muscle, skin of scrotum or labium majus

element.name: genitofemoral nerve, genital branch
element.distribution: muscular branches to cremaster muscle (male only, raise and lower testes in order to regulate temperature of testes and promote spermatogenesis); cutaneous branches to skin of scrotum/male and labium majus/female, mons pubis/female

element.name: ilioinguinal nerve
element.origin: lumbar PLEXUS L1 (sometimes T12); accompanies the spermatic cord through the inguinal canal
element.distribution: skin of scrotum or labia majora, and adjacent part of thigh

element.name: labial nerves, anterior
element.distribution: skin of anterior labial region of labia majora, and adjacent part of thigh

element.name: scrotal nerves, anterior
element.distribution: skin of anterior scrotal region

element.name: iliohypogastric nerve
element.distribution: skin above the pubis and over the lateral side of the buttock, and occasionally the pyramidal muscle

element.name: pudendal nerve
element.branches: enters pudendal canal, gives off inferior anal nerve, and then divides into perineal nerve and dorsal nerve of penis (clitoris)
element.distribution: muscles, skin, and erectile tissue of perineum

element.name: inferior rectal nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne97.htm INFERIOR RECTAL NERVE]; anal nerves, inferior; rectal nerves, inferior hemorrhoidal nerves
element.origin: pudendal nerve, or independently from sacral PLEXUS
element.branches: cutaneous branches mainly, but muscular branches to external anal sphincter
element.distribution: supplying perianal skin and lower part of anal canal; external anal sphincter muscle, skin around anus, and lining of anal canal up to pectinate line

element.name: nerve to urethral bulb
element.distribution: male/bulb of penis, female/clitoral bulbs - erectile tissue; bartholin's gland - secretes mucus to lubricate

element.name: dorsal nerve of clitoris
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne101.htm DORSAL NERVE OF PENIS OR CLITORIS]
element.distribution: deep transverse muscle of perineum, sphincter muscle of urethra, corpus cavernosum of clitoris, and skin, prepuce, and glans of clitoris

element.name: dorsal nerve of penis
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne101.htm DORSAL NERVE OF PENIS OR CLITORIS]
element.distribution: deep transverse muscle of perineum, sphincter muscle of urethra, corpus cavernosum of penis, and skin, prepuce, and glans of penis

element.name: perineal nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/perinealS4.htm PERINEAL BRANCH OF S4]; MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne98.htm PERINEAL NERVE]
element.branches: muscular branches and posterior scrotal or labial nerves
element.distribution: muscular branches supply the bulbocavernous, ischiocavernous, and superficial transverse perineal muscles and bulb of the penis and, in part, the external anal sphincter and levator ani muscles; scrotal (labial) nerves supply scrotum or labium majus

element.name: perineal nerve, deep branch
element.distribution: muscles of the perineum - bulbospongiosus, ischiocavernosus, superficial transverse perineal muscle, deep transverse perineal muscle and sphincter urethrae

element.name: labial nerve, posterior
element.distribution: labium majus

element.name: scrotal nerve, posterior
element.distribution: skin of scrotum

element.name: nerve to levator ani
element.distribution: pelvic surface of levator ani

element.name: anococcygeal nerve
element.distribution: CX, sacrococcygeal joint, coccyx; coccygeus and levator ani muscles, innervate skin between coccyx and anus

element.name: coccygeal nerve
element.origin: either of thirty-first pair of spinal nerves (CX, Co), arising from coccygeal segment of spinal cord

element.name: splanchnic nerves, lumbar
element.distribution: upper nerves ones go to intermesenteric and adjacent plexuses, and lower ones descend to superior hypogastric plexus; sensory - pregnancy and nociception to IML, adds to pelvic nerve

element.name: left hypogastric nerve, ureteric
element.distribution: ureteric smooth muscles

element.name: left hypogastric nerve, prostatic
element.distribution: emission is the result of peristaltic contractions of the ampullary portion of the vas deferens, the seminal vesicles, and the prostatic smooth muscles

element.name: right hypogastric nerve
element.distribution: smooth internal anal sphincter muscle

element.name: splanchnic nerves, pelvic
element.branches: to penis/clitoris/testis/ovary/vagina, to other pelvic structures (urinary bladder, rectum, anus, sigmoid and descending colon, terminal transverse colon, uterus and uterine tubes)
element.distribution: leaving sacral plexus, they enter inferior hypogastric plexus and supply pelvic organs; mating and conception

element.name: cavernous nerves of clitoris
element.distribution: erectile tissue of clitoris

element.name: cavernous nerves of penis
element.distribution: erectile tissue of penis
